FAQS

Let’s get into the details

What does a nonprofit website cost?

 

Our average nonprofit website re-build averages $75,000-$150,000. This is a one-time, fixed fee cost that includes:

  • Digital Strategy
  • UI/UX Design
  • Full-Stack Web Development
  • Copywriting
  • Graphic + Asset Creation
  • Data Entry + Migration
  • Technical SEO Optimization
  • Analytics + Goal Setup
  • UI/UX Guidelines
  • Editors Guidelines
  • Full Ownership of Design + Development
  • Upon Completion
  • 2 Weeks Post-Launch Support

If you’re curious about what your project may cost, check out our project calculator.

How long does it take to build a nonprofit website?

 

From start to finish, our average full nonprofit website re-build takes 6 months to complete.

What results should I expect?

 

Results will vary based on specific goals and your industry.

 

However, on average, our websites…

  • Are effective for 56% longer
  • Convert 82% better
  • Create a 24% lift in organic search results

Do you offer support after the nonprofit website has launched?

 

Yes!

We have a dedicated support team in-house that can handle anything from routine support updates to full-feature launches for existing nonprofit websites.

Do you offer a discount for nonprofits?

 

Yes! We offer a 10% discount to all qualifying nonprofit organizations. 

FAQS

Top Non Profit Website Questions We’re Asked

How much does a non profit website cost?

 

The cost to build a website can vary greatly depending on the complexity of the software, the features and functionality required, the level of customization, and the experience of the development team. A basic website could cost anywhere from $25,000 to $75,000, while a more complex and feature-rich platform could cost upwards of $200,000 or more.

It is important to work with a reputable and experienced development team that can provide a detailed proposal outlining the project, the scope of work and associated costs. It is also important to consider ongoing maintenance and support costs, as well as any additional fees for hosting and infrastructure.

Overall, the cost to build a website should be viewed as an investment in the long-term success of the business.

Our average SaaS website re-build averages $75,000-$150,000. This is a one-time, fixed fee cost that includes:

  • Digital Strategy
  • UI/UX Design
  • Full-Stack Web Development
  • Copywriting
  • Graphic + Asset Creation
  • Data Entry + Migration
  • Technical SEO Optimization
  • Analytics + Goal Setup
  • UI/UX Guidelines
  • Editors Guidelines
  • Full Ownership of Design + Development
  • Upon Completion
  • 2 Weeks Post-Launch Support

If you’re curious about what your project may cost, check out our project calculator.

How long does it take to build a non profit website?

 

The timeline for completing a project depends on several factors such as the complexity of the new website itself, the scope of work required, and how quickly you are able to provide feedback throughout the discovery phase of the process. Typically, projects can range from 4-8 months or longer if there are complex features or integrations needed.

What results should I expect?

 

Results will vary based on specific goals and your industry.

However, on average, our websites…

  • Are effective for 56% longer
  • Convert 82% better
  • Create a 24% lift in organic search results

Do you offer support after the non profit website has launched?

 

Yes!

We have a dedicated support team in-house that can handle anything from routine support updates to full-feature launches for existing websites.

Do you offer a discount for nonprofits?

 

Yes! We offer a 10% discount to all qualifying nonprofit organizations. 

For The Extra Curious

What is Website Design?

 

Website design is the art and science of creating visually appealing and user-friendly websites that engage your visitors and encourage them to take action. It involves a combination of technical and creative skills, as well as a deep understanding of your customers and the user experience.

Design is an integral part of building a website. Our web designers focus on the following to create great user experiences:

  • A website’s code
  • User experience (UX) elements
  • A site’s appearance
  • Site architecture and navigation
  • Website content

Website redesign involves optimizing an existing website that may be out of date or have poor performance.

At Jorban, we can help you with creating a new website or redesigning an existing one. We provide web design services for SaaS companies, ecommerce brands, large enterprises, nonprofits, and many other types of organizations. We’re a top web design agency focusing on original, custom website builds for corporations, small businesses, and nonprofits. We have been designing websites for over a decade, and we’d love to create a responsive website that generates revenue for your organization.

Why does Good Web Design Matter?

 

Good website design is the digital face of your brand, and it plays a vital role in creating the right impression on your visitors. A well-designed website not only elevates the user experience but also boosts credibility, fosters trust, and ultimately drives conversions.

We craft tailored website designs that resonate with your audience, encapsulate your brand’s essence, and streamline user navigation. Our dedicated team of creative professionals works hand-in-hand with you to create visually appealing, mobile-responsive, and lightning-fast websites that deliver an unparalleled user experience.

  • A professionally designed website will help make a great first impression on your visitors and can help establish trust and credibility with your potential customers.
  • Good website design can ensure that your site is easy to navigate, has clear calls to action, and is optimized for mobile devices.
  • We will ensure your website is search engine optimized, which will make it easier for potential customers to find you online.
  • A well-designed website can differentiate your business from your competitors. We will help you communicate your unique value proposition to your customers.
  • Our team of web designers will help you develop a consistent brand identity across your website, social media, and other digital channels.
  • We will save you time and money in the long run by ensuring that your site is optimized for conversions and driving revenue.
  • Our website design services will help you stay current with the latest design trends and technologies.

Our cutting-edge website design services can bring massive improvements to your traffic, image, sales, or messaging.

What are the differences between Web Design, Website Redesign, and Website Refresh?

 

Web design involves all aspects of your site’s user experience, aesthetic, and front-end functionality. Website design can be applied to a new site or an existing one. When applied to an existing website, we refer to it as a “website redesign.” Website redesign is thus a subset of website design.

The terms “website redesign” and “website refresh” are often used synonymously, but we draw a distinction between the two.

  • Website redesign: an in-depth change to multiple aspects of the site, resulting in substantial differences to the website’s appearance, user experience, performance, and underlying code.
  • Website refresh: a refresh is more cosmetic in nature than a redesign and could include updated fonts, an updated color scheme, limited user experience updates (for example, a button that gets a new shape), and other minor improvements.

We are a website design agency based in Pittsburgh, PA and serving the entire US and beyond. Whether you need a spanking new website or a redesign of your existing site, you won’t find a better partner to accomplish your goals.

What should be included in a website design project plan?

 

When we build websites, we always start with a project plan. Your Jorbanproject manager uses the project plan to ensure that goals are clear, tasks are assigned and tracked, and everyone involved in the project is kept up to date.

Here are some of the many things we focus on when creating a project plan, whether we’re working with a startup, a nonprofit, or a Fortune 100 company.

  1. The site needs to be optimized for conversions. Doesn’t matter whether it’s an ecommerce store or a B2B website, conversions are the lifeblood of your business.
  2. Site structure is everything. We build the optimal site architecture with intuitive navigation.
  3. Your value proposition must stand out and be clearly communicated. Everything in the design needs to serve this purpose.
  4. The site needs to exude authority and credibility to your target audience. What resonates with middle-class teenage girls won’t exactly speak to business executives, and vice versa. We make sure your site aligns with your branding strategy and exudes authority and credibility for your ideal customer.
  5. When designing ecommerce websites, we focus on reducing cart abandonment rates and increasing conversions.
  6. For SaaS websites, we craft user-centric interfaces that simplify software adoption and enhance customer engagement.
  7. When we work with charitable organizations, we focus on impactful nonprofit websites that amplify an organization’s cause, promote awareness, and drive donations.
  8. For agencies, we design distinctive online portfolios that showcase your expertise and attract ideal clients.
  9. When engaging with large corporate clients, we develop scalable enterprise websites that elevate a company’s image, streamline business processes, and foster collaboration.
  10. For our business-to-business clients, we create compelling B2B website designs that cultivate professional relationships and drive lead generation.
  11. When designing small business websites, we focus on eye-catching websites that establish a business’s online presence and boost local visibility.
  12. We love working with startups to design a website that will drive demo requests and perform flawlessly.

Can you outline the steps involved in your web design process?

 

When you engage with Jorban, you’re embarking on a collaborative journey. In our initial meeting, we’ll discuss your business objectives and website vision. Together, we’ll develop a tailored web design strategy focused on driving leads and sales for your enterprise.

Here are the stages of our website design process:

  1. Pre-kickoff. We’ll get to know each other, and begin to understand your target audience and their pain points so we can create effective graphic design, visual elements, and content that will capture their attention and inspire action. We’ll also learn more about your brand, business, content management system, and technical requirements.
  2. Kickoff. The official start of the project; we’ll define all elements of the project scope and hold a workshop to define success, work on goal identification, and start thinking through structure, design, and development.
  3. Discovery. This is a critical step of web design. We’re digging deeper, combining notes from the kickoff with our own research and analytics. We build elements like personas, sitemap, and wireframe, as well as other visual design documents. We’ll also set up weekly status meetings with you.
  4. Creative. We make sure we’re on the same page creatively through mood boards and concept designs. We then take those findings to build out prototypes. In this phase of the web design process we also design the website’s real-life interface.
  5. Development. Time to start coding and actually build the website! In the development phase of the website project, you can expect work on the front-end, back-end, and content management systems. Regular check-ins and early access to a staging server allow us to stay in sync with you.
  6. Pre-launch. We’re getting ready for the big day. That means extended testing of all features, bug fixes, fixing broken links, and other tweaks to make sure it’s just right. We’ll also schedule the launch and handover date with you.
  7. Launch. On the day of the launch, our website design and development project team is available to work on any last-minute fixes and adjustments. By the end of the day, you have a fully functioning, beautiful new website.
  8. Post-launch. We’ll work for at least 10 business days with you to fix any bugs or broken links, and to make routine tweaks. We’ll also chat with you on potential long-term engagements for ongoing support.

We build custom websites on Shopify, WordPress, Hubspot, Drupal, and more! Each Jorbansite is built with responsive design to function flawlessly across all devices.

Want to discuss your website design service options? Contact us today-we’re happy to chat!

Website Design Strategy

A top-notch website design goes hand-in-hand with a solid grasp of digital marketing as a whole. We’re pros at making sure your website’s information architecture, messaging, SEO, design, and development come together to captivate your visitors.

By keeping up with the latest research metrics and best practices, we’re able to craft delightful user experiences that fuel success in achieving your inbound marketing goals. Let us help you create a website that not only looks great but also drives results.

UX and UI Design

UX/UI design is crucial to the success of any website. When creating a unique look and feel for your site, we’ll refer to your brand guidelines in order to ensure all visual elements, including colors, logos, graphics, and more, are perfectly cohesive with your company’s messaging, identity, and overall aesthetic.

We make sure the website is easy to navigate and all design elements reflect your brand, which will help craft a seamless user experience that customers can easily identify and interact with.

Website Development

In addition to being a full-service web design agency, we have full-stack web development capabilities. Focusing on website design and development services has allowed us to become experts on the world’s leading web platforms.

Site speed, security, third-party integrations, SEO, and flexibility are paramount for mature businesses. Our designers and developers create custom solutions tailored to address these needs and more. We pair website development with a keen eye for branding and design.

Certainly, could you please provide more details about your web design process so that I can help you turn it into a series of questions?

What key aspects and considerations are covered in your website design guide?

 

When we work with you to design your website, our design team develops a complete website design guide that we leave with you. It will cover our custom design, user experience (UX) components, how our design merges with your brand’s image, and more.

From your homepage design to your product page design, each design element aligns with your brand and your targeted customers to boost sales.

We consult with SaaS companies, B2Bs, startups, ecommerce brands, enterprise companies, creative agencies, and small businesses to connect them with the technology that best meets their needs.

See our design portfolio and browse the clients we’ve helped to get a sense of our abilities.

What is a Website Design Proposal?

 

A website design proposal is a clear statement of how you want your website to look-and what a custom web design would specifically accomplish.

For example, a website design proposal could cover any of the following:

  • We want a website with a user-friendly interface and excellent UX to achieve a low bounce rate from the get go.
  • Our target keywords are highly competitive, and we want to ensure that our new website performs optimally in order to gain a better search presence and capture organic traffic.
  • We’re launching a new brand and marketing campaign, and we want our website to reflect that.

Often, website managers create a website design proposal to get buy-in from key executives who make financial decisions for the company.

How Much Does Website Design Cost?

 

When considering website design costs, it’s important to factor in the complexity of the project. A simple custom site design with basic functionality performed by a digital agency could range between $15,000 and $30,000. This cost may not include additional services such as SEO or content creation.

Bigger and more complex corporate websites done by a professional web agency with extra features and functionality will cost significantly more to design: $40,000 to $75,000 or higher, depending on the scope of the project.

Professional web designs are an investment, part of a long-term marketing plan that helps you reach your target audience and maximize conversions. Your ultimate goal should always be to ensure your website’s responsive design is optimized for performance and usability throughout the entire design journey-from concept to launch.

Our average website design ranges from $50,000 to $150,000 based on the size and complexity of the site. This is inclusive of a two-day strategy workshop, full UI/UX designs, custom theme development, content writing, and on-site SEO. For a more accurate estimate of website costs, be sure to check out our project cost calculator.

If you’re not looking to design an entirely new website but would like to upgrade your existing website, we offer our Grow website refresh packages starting at $5,000/month.

 

What Determines the Price of a Website Design?

 

When it comes to getting a custom quote for professional website design services, there are several factors that play into the price.

The cost of a website design is based on the following factors:

  • The website’s complexity. A more complex website with custom functionalities and features will typically take more time and effort to design.
  • The number of pages. The more pages a website has, the more time and effort each page will require to design.
  • The level of customization. A fully customized website with unique layouts, graphics, and branding elements will be more expensive than a template-based design.
  • The timeframe for completion. A shorter deadline for completing the website design can require your designers to work longer hours, which can increase the cost of the project.
  • Additional services. Services like website hosting, video production, SEO, and ongoing maintenance can add to the overall cost of your website design project.

Multiple landing pages with complex navigation may require more design or coding time than creating only a few simple brochure-style pages.

Additional touches are good to help attract and convert site visitors: good website copywriting, photography, app development, and search engine optimization.

When creating digital experiences, the ultimate goal should be optimizing for both performance and usability. While a CMS can assist in keeping the site organized and easy to maintain, ensuring it is optimized for search engines (national or local SEO) adds even more time and effort. All of these components come together to form the final cost for your website development project.

 

What factors and components does our project calculator take into account when determining the cost of your website design?

 

If you’re considering a new website design, it can be difficult to determine exactly how much your project will cost. Luckily, our project calculator makes the estimating process simple and easy with its intuitive design.

With our project calculator, you can accurately determine the cost of your website design. All you need to do is provide basic information, such as:

  • What kind of website do you want? Are you looking for an ecommerce web design, or you maybe need WordPress web design for a service business?
  • What kind of services do you need? (Developing a cohesive website strategy, creating UX/UI designs tailored to your target audience, crafting engaging and effective copywriting for Shopify or WordPress web, video, or animation)
  • What kind of features do you need for your website? (From news feeds to user walls and social media marketing features, we’ve got you covered.)

We have developed a comprehensive step-by-step breakdown, tailoring each element of the web design and website development process to reflect both your budget and specific goals.

Could you showcase some examples of the websites you have designed?

 

Here are some of our recent web design projects. Contact us to discuss how we can help your institution stand out online.

Browse all our case studies and projects.

What does a web design agency do?

 

A good web design agency creates modern and functional website frontend experiences. Using the latest design tools, an experienced web design team can build a creative, easy-to-use site that fits the company’s brand identity and meets customers’ expectations by carefully analyzing their needs and goals.

Web design agencies often do full planning, which includes working with developers to add things like content management systems, SEO optimization, and technical support. Clients can also use maintenance services after the site goes live to make sure it stays safe and secure. Using the skills and knowledge of a web design agency, businesses can create immersive user experiences that keep customers interested and boost their online presence.

A good web design agency will also work closely with your marketing department or external branding agencies to ensure that the site elevates your brand and conforms to all brand guidelines.

 

How often should you redesign your website?

 

Consumer trends, browser technology, and accessibility requirements are always changing; there is no set schedule for redesigning your website. Rather, you should monitor how your current site performs and where it can be improved.

Examining your current website and your company’s goals on a regular basis can help you find new ways to improve conversion rates (CRO) and user experience (UX) through a website redesign.

 

What kind of website support do you offer?

 

Our website support team is dedicated to providing the highest level of customer service. We understand that you rely on your website functioning smoothly 100% of the time, so we are here to make sure it does!

From resolving technical issues to regularly updating the look and feel of your website, our website support services include:

  1. Data and analytics
  2. UX audits
  3. Website maintenance
  4. Landing page design
  5. Conversion rate optimization
  6. A/B testing
  7. Multivariant testing
  8. Website migration
  9. Split testing
  10. Page speed optimization
  11. Monthly reporting

A website revamp can help ensure that a company’s online presence is prepared for success. Our website redesign services prioritize user experience, web and mobile compatibility, higher engagement rates, improved search engine rankings, creative content displays, and more.

A transparent collaboration

Creating a responsive web design that stands out takes careful coordination. We work with clients to develop visual identities and align their brand message with the right aesthetic. To ensure that our design process succeeds in hitting those targets, you can work side-by-side with our creative team to ensure your website aligns with your brand guidelines.

From the initial wireframes to the fully customized landing page, you will have the opportunity to weigh in on each decision and provide feedback along the way. So when your website publishes, it will be perfectly aligned with your brand’s goals and objectives.

Future proofing your website

Building a successful business involves much more than just having a well designed website. It requires advanced insights into customer experiences, online marketing strategies, and technology trends to ensure that expectations are met and exceeded. That’s why many companies turn to us when they need a website redesign.

We’ve worked with more than one hundred brands over 10 years. We use that experience to predict and incorporate future needs into your website redesign.

 

What are website redesign services?

 

Website redesign services are a makeover for your brand’s online presence. We have extensive knowledge about user experience design, making sure that customers have an enjoyable experience when accessing your business’s website and are able to easily navigate between pages. More potential customers can be reached with an improved website aesthetic and optimized navigational functions.

The goal of any web redesign service is to give your business a fresh face online while improving digital sales performance.

 

What are the top reasons to propose a site redesign?

 

“The need to rebuild a website usually stems from the need to grow and expand, poor rank amongst search engines, and growing expectations of users…” -Truitt, et al., Pace University

Top reasons for web redesign include situations in which an existing website is not adequately accomplishing the following for a brand.

  • Not engaging their buyer personas
  • Not attracting top talent
  • Not fully communicating the value of their products or services
  • Not serving as a lead generation driver
  • Not performing well on mobile devices
  • Not meeting key performance indicators such as conversions
  • Full of poor UX design for a suboptimal customer experience
  • Not connecting with their target audiences
  • Not optimized for search engines.

These are the sorts of rationales that a website redesign proposal will articulate to get executive approval.

 

What is the best website design company?

 

When it comes to finding the best website design company out there, there are a few variables that should be taken into consideration.

Look at their portfolio of websites they have designed to understand the level of quality they can bring to the project.

Check customer reviews and testimonials to get an understanding of the services the marketing agency provides, as well as any recommendations or suggestions from past clients.

Consider the timeline of projects and possible add-ons such as maintenance and support options. Knowing all these criteria will help you make an informed decision when selecting a top web design company that can give you the results that you seek.

Here’s a sampling of some of the top website design companies operating today:

  • Kobe Digital
  • eDesign Interactive
  • Digital Silks
  • Huemor
  • Top Notch Dezigns
  • Lounge Lizard
  • Spinx Digital

 

Are you a digital marketing agency?

 

We do provide some marketing resources, but we are not a full-service digital marketing agency. We are primarily a web design and development company.

 

Do you offer ecommerce development services?

 

Our team of experienced web designers and developers is well-versed in creating top-notch ecommerce websites that are both visually stunning and functionally effective. We understand the importance of a seamless user experience in driving conversions and sales, and we incorporate the latest ecommerce trends and best practices into our designs.

From custom product pages to secure payment gateways, we can create an ecommerce website that meets your unique business needs and goals.

Here are some of the services we offer to ecommerce brands to increase visibility, drive conversions, and grow market share:

  • Ecommerce website design
  • Ecommerce web development
  • Ecommerce page speed optimization
  • Ecommerce conversion rate optimization

In addition to being a Shopify Plus Partner, we are experts in WooCommerce and can help you with anything you need on that platform.

Which digital strategies are the best for growth?

Here are some digital strategies that might help you grow your business.

  1. Search engine optimization (SEO)
  2. Paid advertisements (PPC)
  3. Influencer marketing
  4. Community-building
  5. Affiliate marketing
  6. Industry events (hosting or attending)
  7. Speaking engagements (live, podcasts, other media appearances)
  8. Public relations (PR) outreach
  9. Thought leadership

Of course, results vary wildly for each of these methods from industry to industry and company to company. You’ll need to experiment to find which approach generates the best ROI for you.

 

Does your team have mobile app developers?

 

We are not a mobile app development company per se, but depending on your needs, a web application could potentially be included as part of the scope of work.

Feel free to talk to us about your web project, and we’ll decide if we can serve you or if we prefer to refer you to a software development company that specializes in web applications.

 

Do you offer services across the USA?

 

Whether you’re based in Washington, DC, San Francisco, New York, Denver, Houston, Chicago, Los Angeles, or anywhere else across the US, we can help you with custom web design and development. Our award-winning web design projects span the country, and we’re excited for you to join the ranks.

 

Is it a good idea to do influencer marketing?

 

Many brands have had great results with influencer marketing, particularly in the ecommerce market. It’s all about finding the right influencers with the right budget. When evaluating influencers, pay attention to the size of their audience, how engaged their audience is, and what the demographic makeup of the audience is.

Helpful Resources
